item.title: Something for the Weekend – 18/01/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/01/18/something-for-the-weekend-18-01-25/

Nintendo finally did the thing! They announced the Nintendo Switch 2 with a suitably quirky little trailer showing the physical differences from the original, and a side dish of new Mario Kart to really get the hype train rolling. It’s going to be a long wait until April, though…

In the News This Week

  • Let’s-a go! The Nintendo Switch 2 has been revealed
  • Mario Kart 9 teased during Switch 2 reveal – hints at 24-player races
  • A Nintendo Direct and in-person events for Switch 2 are coming in April
  • Report: Sony cancels two more live service games at Bluepoint & Bend Studio
  • The Blood of Dawnwalker is a new RPG from former The Witcher 3 devs
  • EA Sports FC 25 gameplay refresh update overhauls on the pitch action
  • Want to renovate a basketball court? Sports Renovations is the wholesome sports sim for you
  • The Until Dawn movie teaser explains how it replaces butterfly effect
  • PowerWash Simulator VR support being ended by Futurlab

Games in Review & Featured Articles

Oooooh, there’s a big new entry in a long-running series and genre, as Dynasty Warriors: Origins looks to revive the musou series, and does a damn fine job of it!

  • Dynasty Warriors: Origins – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 9/10
  • Tales of Graces f Remastered – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 9/10
  • Donkey Kong Country Returns HD – NSW – 8/10
  • Uncle Chop’s Rocket Shop – PS5, PS4, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Threefold Recital – PC – 8/10

Away from the reviews, I discussed the Nintendo Switch 2’s reveal and how playing it safe was probably the right move from Nintendo, even if it’s not as exciting as another paradigm shift. Meanwhile, Dom’s been playing Indiana Jones and thinking of it in terms of the serials that inspired the original films.

And I had a quick preview of Drop Duchy, a quirky roguelite deckbuilder Tetris-y strategy game. Indie game wordsalad, to be sure, but it does actually work.

Rounding things out as always, What We Played featured Marvel Rivals, Kingdom Come: Deliverances and Dynasty Warriors: Origins.

Most Wanted 2025

We’ve wrapped up our Most Wanted Games of 2025 feature, going one-by-one through the top five. Here’s the now completed list of 50 titles:

  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #50 to #46
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #45 to #41
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #40 to #36
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #35 to #31
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #30 to #26
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #25 to #21
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #20 to #16
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #15 to #11
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #10 to #6
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #5 Death Stranding 2: On The Beach
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #4 Metroid Prime 4: Beyond
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #3 Doom: The Dark Ages
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #2 Monster Hunter Wilds
  • Our Most Wanted Games of 2025 – #1 Ghost of Yōtei

Obviously we compile this before the Switch 2 reveal, so there’s no Mario Kart 9 on there. I’d guess it would’ve been third or fourth, otherwise.

Trailer Park

New Sniper Elite: Resistance trailer showcases its bone-crunching new features

The Until Dawn movie trailer is looking promising

Assetto Corsa EVO Early Access is out now

Mai gameplay trailer for Street Fighter 6 has dropped

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!

item.title: Check out the demo for Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero and carry your save over to the main game
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/01/18/check-out-the-demo-for-phantom-brave-the-lost-hero-and-carry-your-save-over-to-the-main-game/

Compressed by jpeg-recompress

We do love a bit of weekend news, and while you’ve got time on your hands seems like the perfect time to tell you about the brand new demo that’s just dropped for Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero. Arriving for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4 and Nintendo Switch – unfortunately there’s no demo for you PC players – you can now thoroughly bed yourself in with the story for this amazing looking strategy-RPG as the demo will take you through the first two chapters. On top of that, Nippon Ichi have made the categorically correct choice to let your save carry over into the main game. So, what I’m saying is, go and play the start of this game. I don’t think you’ll be disappointed.

Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero is the sequel to the iconic original, Phantom Brave. Set in Ivoire, a area punctuated by diverse islands. You play Marona, an incredibly cheerful girl, especially considering she can talk to the souls of dead people. Where it comes in handy is that she can interact with Ash, a dead Chroma, or bounty hunter, who used to work with Marona’s parents. He’s now her protector, and together they set out to solve the islands’ problems, via the medium of strategy RPG action. It’s the perfect arrangement.

What’s particularly cool about Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero is the way it retains the character of the original game, while updating the visuals in a Chibi 3D art style. It’s certainly a great-looking game, with beautiful hi-res character artwork and chunky 3D visuals. Marona finds herself separated from Ash, and instead has to team up with Apricot, the ghost of a pirate ship captain’s daughter. I think you’ll be happily swept up in its ghost-ship centric tale when it launches for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, PC and Nintendo Switch on January 30th.
